title: Introduction to respiranor
text: Instead working directly total data, might want use certain combination time, location, outcome. recommend using data.table syntax data filtering subsetting. example, get weekly Covid cases hospital admissions main cause Norway: details, please refer vignette data documentation. Several CSIDS packages (csstyle, csalert) make use respiranor data. can read following documentation find , Epicurves cstyle, Short term trend COVID cases csalert.
code: # load total data (419k rows) totaldata <- respiranor::total_b2020  # get weekly cases (confirmed) and hospitalisation for Norway case_hosp <- totaldata[granularity_time == 'isoyearweek' &                      granularity_geo == 'nation',                    .(date,                       location_name,                       cases = cases_by_testdate_n,                       hospital_adm = hospital_admissions_main_cause_n)] case_hosp #>            date location_name cases hospital_adm #>   1: 2022-11-13         Norge   534           60 #>   2: 2022-11-06         Norge   876          174 #>   3: 2022-10-30         Norge   780          151 #>   4: 2022-10-23         Norge   561          120 #>   5: 2022-10-16         Norge   499          117 #>  ---                                             #> 139: 2020-03-22         Norge  1438          188 #> 140: 2020-03-15         Norge  1215           50 #> 141: 2020-03-08         Norge   217            2 #> 142: 2020-03-01         Norge    30            0 #> 143: 2020-02-23         Norge     1            0

title: Introduction to respiranor
text: package curates publicly available COVID-19 data Norway 2020-04-24 2022-11-14. original data repository (surveillance_data) automatically published machine-friendly COVID-19 data updates weekdays 13:15 can accessed . original repository archived Sykdomspulsen team Norwegian Institute Public Health due lack funding.

title: Data details
text: following groups Covid data, certain combinations time location specifications. two type time granularity: day (date) week (isoyearweek) data. geo granularity, country (nation), county (county)municipality (municip). Note outcomes interest municipality level data. Population data attached compute number cases per 100.000 population certain location. dataset provide total age groups sex groups.

title: Data details
text: Cases PCR test confirmed Covid positive cases. following variables: number cases (counts, per 100.000 population) date PCR test, cases_by_testdate_n, cases_by_testdate_vs_pop_pr100000 number cases (counts, per 100.000 population) date registration, cases_by_regdate_n, cases_by_regdate_vs_pop_pr100000 Available granularity_time: date, isoyearweek granularity_geo: nation, county, municip (registration date)

title: Data details
text: Tests number testing events. following variables: number testing events (, positive, negative), testevents_all_n, testevents_pos_n, testevents_neg_n percentage testing events positive, testevents_pos_vs_all_pr100 Available granularity_time: date, isoyearweek granularity_geo: nation

title: Data details
text: provide two variables related hospital admissions: admission due Covid main cause, hospital_admissions_main_cause_n; ICU admission, icu_admissions_n. Available granularity_time: date, isoyearweek granularity_geo: nation

title: Data details
text: vaccination provide data two dates: vaccination date registration date. data 4 doses. dose, following (e.g.¬†dose 1): number vaccinations delivered date, vax_dose_1_by_vaxdate_n number vaccinations registered SYSVAK, vax_dose_1_by_regdate_n cumulative number vaccinations delivered date, vax_dose_1_by_vaxdate_sum0_999999_n Available granularity_time: date, isoyearweek granularity_geo: nation, county, municip (registration date)

title: Data details
text: Instead working directly total data, might want use certain combination time, location, outcome. recommend using data.table syntax data filtering subsetting. way organize time location codes documented detail another csverse package, cstidy. highly recommend read vignette!

title: Data details
text: get weekly Covid cases hospital admissions main cause Norway (nation):
code: # load total data (419k rows) totaldata <- respiranor::total_b2020  # get weekly cases (confirmed) and hospitalisation for Norway case_hosp <- totaldata[granularity_time == 'isoyearweek' &                      granularity_geo == 'nation',                    .(date,                       location_name,                       cases = cases_by_testdate_n,                       hospital_adm = hospital_admissions_main_cause_n)] case_hosp[1:6,] #>          date location_name cases hospital_adm #> 1: 2022-11-13         Norge   534           60 #> 2: 2022-11-06         Norge   876          174 #> 3: 2022-10-30         Norge   780          151 #> 4: 2022-10-23         Norge   561          120 #> 5: 2022-10-16         Norge   499          117 #> 6: 2022-10-09         Norge   511          101

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhang C, White RA (2023). respiranor: Public COVID-19 Data Norway. https://www.csids./respiranor/, https://github.com/csids/respiranor.
code: @Manual{,   title = {respiranor: Public COVID-19 Data for Norway},   author = {Chi Zhang and Richard Aubrey White},   year = {2023},   note = {https://www.csids.no/respiranor/, https://github.com/csids/respiranor}, }

title: Public COVID-19 Data for Norway
text: respiranor cleans merges publicly available datasets COVID-19 Norway analysis-ready datasets. following data provided package: case numbers ICU/hospital admissions testing vaccinations Read introduction vignette run help(package="respiranor").

title: Public COVID-19 Data for Norway
text: csverse set R packages developed help solve problems frequently occur performing disease surveillance. want install dev versions (access packages haven‚Äôt released CRAN), run usethis::edit_r_profile() edit .Rprofile. write : Save file restart R. can now install csverse packages drat repository.
code: options(   repos = structure(c(     CSVERSE = "https://www.csids.no/drat/",     CRAN    = "https://cran.rstudio.com"   )) ) install.packages("respiranor")

title: COVID-19 data for total age/sex in Norway (2020 border). ‚Äî total_b2020
text: dataset contains COVID-19 data Norway, 2020 week 8 (2020-02-23) 2022 week 45 (2022-11-13)

title: COVID-19 data for total age/sex in Norway (2020 border). ‚Äî total_b2020
COVID-19 data for total age/sex in Norway (2020 border). ‚Äî total_b2020
text: granularity_time Time granularity: day, isoyearweek granularity_geo Geographical granularity: nation, county, municip location_code Location code border Redistricting border: 2020 age Age category: total sex Sex category: total isoyear Isoyear isoweek Isoweek isoyearweek Isoyearweek season Season seasonweek Season week calyear Calendar year calmonth Calendar month date Date title: COVID-19 data for total age/sex in Norway (2020 border). ‚Äî total_b2020
